description: A medium-large parrot with extreme sexual dimorphism. Males are a brilliant emerald green with a candy-corn colored beak, while females are a stunning combination of bright red and royal blue/purple.
temperament: Generally calm, gentle, and intelligent. They are less prone to screaming than Amazons or Cockatoos. Females tend to be more dominant and territorial than the more easy-going males.
loudness: Moderate. Much quieter than most large parrots, making them suitable for many home environments. They have a range of calls, but are not constant screamers.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-yellow-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Moderate"><title>Moderate</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7zm9.5 2.5c0 .75-.38 1.41-.97 1.82v-3.64c.59.41.97 1.07.97 1.82zM14 8.25v7.5c1.18-.41 2-1.57 2-2.75s-.82-2.34-2-2.75z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Good talking ability with clear, pleasant voices. Both sexes can learn words and phrases, and can be quite chatty, though individuals vary.
dietaryNeeds: A specialized diet with a heavy emphasis on fresh fruits and vegetables is crucial. They have a longer digestive tract and cannot handle many artificial ingredients or fortified pellets.
healthPointers: Can live 30-50+ years. Prone to toe-tapping and wing-flipping if their diet is incorrect (too many vitamins/minerals). Sensitive to medications and artificial additives.
housing: Large cage minimum 36"W x 24"D x 48". Bar spacing 3/4 to 1 inch. They are less destructive than many large parrots but still need plenty of toys.
